column4: Yesterday , I installed kde with 'sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop' , then i just find i don't like kde at all, so i uninstalled it with synaptic, but when i use command 'locate kubuntu', i still found some files, so i deleted them, but when i install some new software today , it always warn me that some 'kubuntu-...'files can't found, so what can i do now?
you could try installing kubuntu-desktop again
and then uninstall it again
oh, god...
some applications depend on KDE libraries, so you might have inadvertently deleted some of them
what's the problem?
then, do it again...?
Couldn't I just install some package instead?
sure, but you could have deleted files that other programs are depending on that you already have installed
but yeah, you could just try reinstalling packages when things error
ok, but it's really a big project to install kubuntu-desktop again...
I just select the package install under the kubuntu-environment group
then, apply
you probably still have all of the packages downloaded in /var/cache/apt/archives
but I'm actually not sure if that will fix your problem, because I think the system thinks that a package is installed, but really some of its underlying files have been deleted by you
keith, no, do you know a tweak app named 'ubuntu-tweak'? i always use it after my updating or installing.
I think so, too
Are you sure it will works if I just do the install and uninstall again?
no, like I said... I'm actually not sure if that will fix your problem, because I think the system thinks that a package is installed, but really some of its underlying files have been deleted by you
you will probably have to "reinstall" certain packages that are broken
Ok, i'll try
and wilee-nilee, thank you .
no problem, good luck!
